raw institutional statement: Incubator Policy
podling reporting
each podling in incubation must report to the incubator pmc
podlings shall report monthly for their first three months, after that quarterly.
ex_constraint: monthly for their first three months

raw institutional statement: the incubator pmc may, at their discretion, ask a podlings to report more frequently.
the ppmc with the mentor(s) help, must produce a report for the incubator pmc detailing overall progress toward graduation and any issues the podling has encountered.
ex_constraint: detailing overall progress toward graduation and any issues the podling has encountered.

raw institutional statement: website
there are restrictions on where podlings can host their websites and what branding they can use on them.
branding
there are restrictions about how podlings can use their own and other asf brands and names.
publicity
there are some restrictions about how podlings can advertise themselves, especially in press releases related to podlings.
ac_condition: in press releases related to podlings

raw institutional statement: disclaimers
podling web sites must include a clear disclaimer on their website and in all documentation, releases and release announcements stating that they are in incubation.
ac_condition: stating that they are in incubation
stating that they are in incubation
stating that they are in incubation
stating that they are in incubation

raw institutional statement: a podling has a choice of two disclaimers: a standard disclaimer or a work-in-progress disclaimer.
podlings wishing to use a different disclaimer message must have the incubator pmc approve it before use.
ac_condition: [when] wishing to use a different disclaimer message

raw institutional statement: standard disclaimer
podlings wanting to follow all asf policy on releases should use the following text for all disclaimers (replace the underlined text as appropriate):
ac_condition: [when] wanting to follow all asf policy on releases

raw institutional statement: apache podling-name is an effort undergoing incubation at the apache software foundation (asf), sponsored by the name of apache tlp sponsor .

incubation is required of all newly accepted projects until a further review indicates that the infrastructure, communications, and decision making process have stabilized in a manner consistent with other successful asf projects.
ac_condition: until a further review indicates that the infrastructure, communications, and decision making process have stabilized in a manner consistent with other successful asf projects.

raw institutional statement: while incubation status is not necessarily a reflection of the completeness or stability of the code, it does indicate that the project has yet to be fully endorsed by the asf.
for releases, the text should be included in a separate disclaimer file stored alongside the notice and license files.
ex_constraint: in a separate disclaimer file stored alongside the notice and license files.

raw institutional statement: work in progress disclaimer
podling wishing to make releases that may not follow all asf policy should use the following disclaimer (replace the underlined text where needed):
ac_condition: [when] wishing to make releases that may not follow all asf policy

raw institutional statement: apache podling-name is an effort undergoing incubation at the apache software foundation (asf), sponsored by the name of apache tlp sponsor .
some of the incubating project's releases may not be fully compliant with asf policy.
for example, releases may have incomplete or un-reviewed licensing conditions.
for example, releases may have incomplete or un-reviewed licensing conditions.
what follows is a list of issues the project is currently aware of (this list is likely to be incomplete):
list of known issues goes here

if you are planning to incorporate this work into your product/project, please be aware that you will need to conduct a thorough licensing review to determine the overall implications of including this work.
ac_condition: if planning to incorporate this work into your product/project

raw institutional statement: for the current status of this project through the apache incubator, visit: https://incubator.apache.org/projects/ apache podling-name .html
for releases, the text should be included in a separate disclaimer-wip file stored alongside the notice and license files.
ex_constraint: in a separate disclaimer-wip file stored alongside the notice and license files.

raw institutional statement: releases
the podling can make non-asf releases while incubating as long as it is moving towards making asf releases.
ex_constraint: as long as it is moving towards making asf releases.

raw institutional statement: podlings must not perform any asf releases of software without the approval of the incubator pmc.
ex_constraint: without the approval of the incubator pmc.

raw institutional statement: when a podling decides it wants to make an asf release, the podling must hold a vote on their public dev list.
ac_condition: when [deciding] to make an asf release

raw institutional statement: at least three +1 votes are required (see the apache voting process page) and more +1 votes than -1 votes.
if the vote passes, the podling must send a summary of that vote to the incubator's general list and request that the incubator pmc approve the release.
three +1 incubator pmc votes are required to approve a release.
should the incubator pmc vote to approve a release, the podling may make that release available to the public under these conditions:
ac_condition: should the incubator pmc vote to approve a release

raw institutional statement: the release archive(s) must include the word "incubating" in the filename.
the release archive(s) must contain a disclaimer (see above), which should be placed in a disclaimer or disclaimer-wip file.
ex_constraint: placed in a disclaimer or disclaimer-wip file.

raw institutional statement: releases for the podling must be distributed through http://www.apache.org/dist/incubator/ podling.
the podling may choose to distribute approved releases through other channels by following the guidelines here .
ex_constraint: through other channels by following the guidelines here

raw institutional statement: adding ppmc members
after voting someone into the ppmc on the ppmc private list, the podling must send a notice email to the private@incubator list.
ac_condition: after voting someone into the ppmc on the ppmc private list

raw institutional statement: the ppmc must wait for 72 hours before inviting the new ppmc member to join the ppmc.
joining the ipmc
after a vote has finished, the ipmc must send a notice email to the board
and then wait for 72 hours before inviting the proposed member.
any asf member can ask to be an ipmc member, without a vote, but the ipmc must still give notice to the board.

ac_condition: [when] asf member ask to be an ipmc member without a vote

raw institutional statement: termination
the incubator pmc should notify a podling of any policy violations.
it may consider termination of a podling that does not correct such violations.
Community Guide
what is an open and diverse community?
a major criterion for podling graduation to top level project (tlp) status is to have developed an open and diverse meritocratic community.
people
as a project grows, it needs to renew itself by accepting new committers.
a project needs to learn how it can recruit new developers and committers into the community.
community members must learn ways to resolve technical conflicts without destroying personal relationships.
communication
projects need to preserve, and post back to the lists, significatn conversation threads in other channels.
project should post regular reminders that other secondary forms of communication exist.
direct_object: remainders that other secondary forms of communication exist

raw institutional statement: community building
before a podling graduates, it must create a diverse and self-sustaining community.
to address this challenge, committers may need to devote more time to community-building and less to development.
if the podling's software has lots of users but very few new developers, the community needs to do more work to encourage users to become developers.
aim: work to encourage to become developers
ac_condition: if the podling's software has lots of users but very few new developers

raw institutional statement: helping developers become committers
to become an apache committer, a developer needs to hang around long enough to accumulate a track record of contributions.
aim: hang around long enough to accumulate
ac_condition: [if want to] become an apache committer

raw institutional statement: promptly reviewing patches or pull requests is essential.
provide credit in the commit message and when closing the issue.
PPMC Guide
podling project management committee (ppmc)
each podling project management committee (ppmc) helps its podling learn how to govern itself.
aim: help learn how to govern itself

raw institutional statement: the ppmc is directly responsible for the oversight of the podling, and it also decides who to add as a ppmc member.
private email list
the mentors should verify that all ppmc members are subscribed to the private list.
each member of the ppmc should be on the dev list, so posting to dev is sufficient.
each member of the incubator pmc is on the incubator general list, so posting to the general list is sufficient.
podling status reports
on a monthly basis, the ipmc collects reports from each incubating project and sends them to the asf board.
currently, new podlings report to the incubator monthly for the first three months, then quarterly after that.
the ppmc does not have to fill out the report itself; the ppmc is just responsible for making sure that it gets filled out.
aim: make sure it is filled out

raw institutional statement: mentors must sign off on podling reports.
- if there is no mentor sign off, the ipmc will not accept the report from that podling; it will have to submit a new report in the following month.
ac_condition: if there is no mentor sign off,
if there is no mentor sign off,

raw institutional statement: the podling incubator reports should document any committers added since the previous report.
if the nominee is already an apache committer on another project, the ipmc member can add the nominee as a committer on the podling via the whimsy podling roster .
ac_condition: if the nominee is already an apache committer on another project,
ex_constraint: on the podling via the whimsy podling roster

raw institutional statement: voting in a new ppmc member
it should be a goal of a podling to have all committers participate in the ppmc.
the ppmc should take an active role in watching committers develop as community participants.
aim: take an active role in watching

raw institutional statement: they should identify those who are participating at a community level (not just a technical one), and approach them with an offer of ppmc membership.

ex_constraint: with an offer of ppmc membership

raw institutional statement: any member of the ppmc can propose a new member of the ppmc.
the proposal should be discussed in private on the ppmc's private email list, with a subject line of "[discuss] joe bob ppmc membership".
ex_constraint: in private on the ppmc's private email list, with a subject line of "[discuss] joe bob ppmc membership"

raw institutional statement: if there is consensus that the proposed member is suitable, there should be a formal vote with the subject line of "[vote] joe bob ppmc membership" on the ppmc's private email list.
ac_condition: if there is consensus that the proposed member is suitable
ex_constraint: with the subject line of "[vote] joe bob ppmc membership" on the ppmc's private email list.

raw institutional statement: if the vote is successful, a member of the ppmc sends a message to the ppmc private email list, with the subject line of "[vote][result] joe bob ppmc membership".
ex_constraint: with the subject line of "[vote][result] joe bob ppmc membership".

raw institutional statement: the nominating ppmc member should send a message to the ipmc ( private@incubator.apache.org ) with a reference to the vote result in the following form:
ex_constraint: with a reference to the vote result in the following form:

raw institutional statement: once the proposed member has accepted, a moderator for the ppmc mail list accepts the new member's subscription request.
attribute_property: moderator for the ppmc mail list
ac_condition: once the proposed member has accepted,

raw institutional statement: adding mentors
a mentor must be an ipmc member.
people who are not ipmc members can still help out in an informal capacity.
ipmc members are free to volunteer to mentor a podling.
to do so, they should mail the podling stating their intentions.
the podling should then decide whether it wants to add the mentor.
if the podling decides to add the mentor, it should do so in the whimsy podling roster .
ac_condition: if the podling decides to [do so]

raw institutional statement: removing a mentor
ppmc and binding votes
Apache Cookbook
does our project fit the apache incubator?
what are the steps to becoming an apache software foundation top-level project?
finding a champion and mentors
to enter the incubator, your project needs a champion and at least two or three mentors .
these people need to be part of the incubator pmc, which asf members can join just by asking.
these people need to be part of the incubator pmc, which asf members can join just by asking.
they may stay on to act as a mentor after that.
aim: stay on to act as a mentor

raw institutional statement: the mentors accompany the podling through all phases that lead to graduation as a top-level project.
creating an incubation proposal
the champion helps the podling prepare an incubation proposal that describes the incoming project for the initial discussions with the incubator pmc.
ex_constraint: proposal that describes the incoming project for the initial discussions with the incubator pmc.

raw institutional statement: discussing the incubation proposal

once the proposal is ready, the podling representatives send it to the general@incubator.a.o list for discussion, with a subject line like [discuss] foo proposal to raise the incubator pmc's attention.
ex_constraint: to the general@incubator.a.o list for discussion, with a subject line like [discuss] foo proposal to raise the incubator pmc's attention.

raw institutional statement: once the discussion phase is finished, the champion or a podling representative starts a [vote] thread on the general@incubator.a.o list.
ac_condition: once the discussion phase is finished
once the discussion phase is finished

raw institutional statement: the vote happens according to the asf voting rules .
ex_constraint: according to the asf voting rules
according to the asf voting rules

raw institutional statement: podling infrastructure setup
once the incubator pmc votes to establish the podling, its infrastructure can be set up. usually, the champion or incubation mentors drive this process.
ac_condition: once the incubator pmc votes to establish the podling
once the incubator pmc votes to establish the podling

raw institutional statement: however, it can also be driven by podling community members if they know how to proceed.
ac_condition: if they know how to proceed.

raw institutional statement: publicity and announcements
project can not issue press releases or other public statements about joining the asf before the incubator pmc accepts the podling.
there are also some restrictions about how podlings can advertise themselves and especially around press releases related to podlings.
importing the initial code
a specific process exists do donate code to the asf, which podlings also need to follow, based on software grants and/or cclas .
ex_constraint: based on software grants and/or cclas

raw institutional statement: community building
during incubation, the podling is expected to build and expand its community, which includes voting in new committers and ppmc members.
discussions of candidates and votes happen on the podling's private ppmc mailing list.
ex_constraint: on the podling's private ppmc mailing list.

raw institutional statement: discussions of candidates and votes happen on the podling's private ppmc mailing list.
ex_constraint: on the podling's private ppmc mailing list.

raw institutional statement: podling releases
producing fully-conformant releases is a condition for graduation.

podling releases must also include the word "incubating" in any release file names and include a disclaimer or disclaimer-wip as per the incubator releases guide , to prevent any confusion as to the projectâ€™s status.
ex_constraint: as per the incubator releases guide
as per the incubator releases guide

raw institutional statement: two-phase vote on podling releases
then, if that first vote is successful, the incubator pmc holds a vote on the incubator general mailing list.
ac_condition: if that first vote is successful,
ex_constraint: on the incubator general mailing list

raw institutional statement: graduation readiness assessment
once the podling community starts feeling ready to graduate, they should make a self-assessment of that readiness.
ac_condition: once the podling community starts feeling ready to graduate

raw institutional statement: graduation discussion

once the community and its incubation mentors feel that the podling is ready to graduate, based on their readiness self-assessment, a mentor or a member of the ppmc starts a [discuss] thread on the incubator general email list, proposing graduation and asking the incubator pmc to review the podling.
ac_condition: once the community and its incubation mentors feel that the podling is ready to graduate
ex_constraint: on the incubator general email list, proposing graduation and asking the incubator pmc to review the podling.

ac_condition: once the community and its incubation mentors feel that the podling is ready to graduate
ex_constraint: on the incubator general email list, proposing graduation and asking the incubator pmc to review the podling.

raw institutional statement: transfering trademarks to the asf
if the people or organizations that donated the podling code to the asf own trademarks that the podling needs, they must transfer the trademarks to the asf before the podling can graduate.
graduation vote

once the discussion dies down on the graduation proposal, a mentor or a member of the ppmc starts a [vote] thread on the incubator general mailing list, in which incubator pmc members cast their votes whether to recommend graduation to the asf's board of directors.
ex_constraint: on the incubator general mailing list
on the incubator general mailing list

raw institutional statement: asf board resolution
once the incubator pmc votes to graduate a podling, the ipmc sends the board resolution that was created for the vote to the asf's board of directors.
ac_condition: once the ipmc votes to graduate a podling

raw institutional statement: post-graduation tasks
once graduated, the podling needs to reflect its new status on the incubator status pages and make a few changes to its resources and processes.
Mentor guide
add to incubation summary file
initialize podling status page
a mentor needs to create the web page that will track the project's status.
direct_object: web page that will track the project status

raw institutional statement: a mentor will also need to update it until others in the project's ppmc can update it .
ac_condition: until others in the project's ppmc can update it

raw institutional statement: as the startup process continues and resources are created the status should be updated.
ac_condition: as the startup process continues and resources are created

raw institutional statement: mentors must be on the ipmc
any prospective mentors who are not yet on the ipmc should ask to be added (by election).
attribute_property: prospective who are not yet on the ipmc

raw institutional statement: email the application to private@incubator.apache.org .
attribute_property: prospective who are not yet on the ipmc

raw institutional statement: cla and ccla submission
prospective committers need to submit a contributor license agreement ( cla ).
Graduation guide
checking the status file
the incubator pmc will check this file when they vote on the graduation of your project.
ac_condition: when they vote on the graduation of your project.

raw institutional statement: creating an apache release
projects need to cut releases. apache projects need to understand how to cut apache releases.
creating an open and diverse community
a major criterion for graduation is to have developed an open and diverse meritocratic community.
the recommendation vote
the resolution should be proposed on the general incubator list before a vote is started to allow feedback.
ac_condition: before a vote is started to allow feedback

raw institutional statement: once a consensus has been reached, a vote should be started on the same general incubator list by a member of the ppmc proposing that the ipmc recommends the resolution to the board .
ac_condition: once a consensus has been reached
ex_constraint: on the same general incubator list by a member of the ppmc proposing that the ipmc recommends the resolution to the board .

raw institutional statement: press releases for new tlps

once there is clear consensus that the recommendation will happen, a member of the ppmc should contact asf marketing publicity at press(at)apache(dot)org if your project is interested in a formal press release announcing your graduation.
ac_condition: if your project is interested in a formal press release announcing your graduation.

raw institutional statement: graduating to a subproject
the incubator project management committee needs to approve the graduation of the podling to a subproject.
subproject acceptance vote
a formal vote by the project pmc to accept the podling as a subproject is a prerequisite.
graduation approval vote

once the accepting tlp have voted to accept the podling and the podling has voted to become a subproject, noticed should be sent to the ipmc via general at incubator.a.o email list indicating that the podling will become a subproject.
ac_condition: once the accepting tlp have voted to accept the podling and the podling has voted to become a subproject
ex_constraint: via general at incubator.a.o email list indicating that the podling will become a subproject.

raw institutional statement: if after 72 hours no issues are raised, the podling may be considered a subproject of the accepting tlp.
likewise, if any ipmc member raises an issue, that should be discussed.
if the issue is addressed, the member raising the issue should indicate they rescind their concerns or otherwise consider them resolved.
Retirement guide
deciding to retire
the final decision to retire the podling takes the form of a vote by the ipmc on general@incubator. the vote should be by lazy consensus.
ex_constraint: on general@incubator. the vote should be by lazy consensus.

raw institutional statement: steps to retirement
once the ipmc vote to retire the podling has closed, a mentor or other volunteer needs to perform the following steps.
ac_condition: once the ipmc vote to retire the podling has closed
once the ipmc vote to retire the podling has closed

raw institutional statement: Release Management guide
what goes into an asf release
ipmc members will check for compliance with the asf policies and with incubator policies.
aim: check for compliance with the asf policies and with incubator policies
